result.execSummary:
The defendant Heidi G. Meade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Heidi G. Meade is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Heidi G. Meade was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 days to pay or CV Judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heidi G. Meade

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Kristyne Watson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 2 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentenced to serve 22 days in Co. Jail, credit for 22 days served.  Pay costs within 30 days or civil judgment to be entered.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
atty K Watson
Jury selection on August 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

With Atty Watson and ADA Delgado the JSH of 4/9/15 at 11:15pm and the JS of 4/20/15 at 9am are rescheduled, as Atty Watson is just taking over the case from Atty King and says there are many things that need to be done before trial and she would like a DA PTC; therefore a DA PTC is set for 4/17/15 at 1:30pm, a FPT is set for 5/11/15 at 8:30am and a JS is set for 8/24/15 at 9am.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney E King.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty King requests to take off trial date and schedule status for appointment of new counsel.  Court allows Atty King to withdraw as counsel; leaves case on for trial on 4/20/15 at 9am; JSH continued to 4/9/15 at 11:15am (deft does not need to appear for JSH).  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney E King.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 4/2/15 at 1:15pm and JS 4/20/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney E King.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 11/25/14 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Everett King. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for subsitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. King. Tab pulled for Judge Wagner. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. DAPT on 9-19-14 @ 1:30pm. Judicial pretrial on 11-3-14 @ 8:45am. Atty. King has filed bond motion and argues for bond modification. Bond modified to a $1000 signature bond with the following conditions: No violent contact with S.M.D. (DOB 11-21-1997), not to possess or consume alcohol, not to possess or consume controlled substances without a prescription.
